      • create

        public void create(android.content.Context context)
        This method initializes the core.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the core systems.

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(CoreCallback callback)
        Sets the callback method that the ui can provide to get indications from the core. see CoreEvent.java for further details.
        Parameters:
        callback - The ui should provide a callback that will called by the core in case of important events. see CoreCallback.

      • setForegroundServiceNotification

        public void setForegroundServiceNotification(android.app.Notification fgsn)
        Sets the foreground service notification. Call this method in your application class in onCreate().

      • getForegroundServiceNotification

        public android.app.Notification getForegroundServiceNotification()
        Gets the foreground service notification.
        Returns:
        The foreground service notification.

      • startForegroundService

        public void startForegroundService()
        Starts the core service as a foreground service. You need to provide a foreground service notification. (see setForegroundServiceNotification)

      • getCallback

        public CoreCallback getCallback()
        Will be used by the core.
        Returns:
        The callback that has been set by the user.

        Enables the scanning of Advertisements.

      • pauseScanningFor

        public boolean pauseScanningFor(long time)
        Paues the scanning for other apps for the amount of minutes.
        Parameters:
        time - The length of time how long the scanner has to wait.
        Returns:
        false if the number is bigger then MAX_PAUSE_TIME.

      • pauseAdvertisingFor

        public boolean pauseAdvertisingFor(long time)
        Pauses the advertising for the specified amount of time.
        Parameters:
        time - The amount of time to pause.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the pause have been set. False if the pause was too long. Max 2h.

      • isScanningEnabled

        public boolean isScanningEnabled()
        Return true if scanning is enabled.
        Returns:
        Return true if scanning is enabled.

        Returns:

      • enableKeepBTOn

        public void enableKeepBTOn(boolean enable)
        True if the core should keep the bluetooth switched on. Warning: This can conflict with the user experience.
        Parameters:
        enable - true if the core should keep the bluetooth switched on.

      • isKeepBTOn

        public boolean isKeepBTOn()
        Returns the state of keepBTon.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the core keeps bluetooth switched on.

        public void startExport()
        Starts the export of the user data to the backend. see CoreCallback and CoreEvent to catch to correct export events.

      • setApiEndpoints

        public void setApiEndpoints(java.lang.String json)
                     throws org.json.JSONException,
                            InvalidBackendEndpointException,
                            MissingBackendEndpointException,
                            InvalidBackendEndpointFormatException
        Sets the endpoints.
        Parameters:
        json - Ths json with endpoints.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If the json format is wrong.
        InvalidBackendEndpointException - If the user has specified an invalid endpoint name.
        MissingBackendEndpointException - If a specific endpoint is missing.
        InvalidBackendEndpointFormatException - If the number of endpoints in the json is wrong.
